issue.title: Feature: group command for easy read

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

milestone.description: This is the next stable feature release of Helm 3.

issue.body:
group command for easy read 
Fix #7903

issue.title: feature: add options command for show global flag

labels.name: size/XL
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 500-999 lines, ignoring generated files.

milestone.description: This is the next stable feature release of Helm 3.

issue.body:
<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request!  Here are some tips for you:
1. Make sure to read the Contributing Guide before submitting your PR: https://github.com/helm/helm/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
2. If this PR closes another issue, add 'closes #<issue number>' somewhere in the PR summary. GitHub will automatically close that issue when this PR gets merged. Alternatively, adding 'refs #<issue number>' will not close the issue, but help provide the reviewer more context.-->

**What this PR does / why we need it**:
add options command for show global flag
fix  https://github.com/helm/helm/pull/7917#issuecomment-626189561
**Special notes for your reviewer**:

**If applicable**:
- [x] this PR contains documentation
- [ ] this PR contains unit tests
- [ ] this PR has been tested for backwards compatibility

issue.title: Using flags instead of persistent flags on status

labels.name: size/XS
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 0-9 lines, ignoring generated files.

milestone.description: This is the next stable feature release of Helm 3.

issue.body:
Persistent flags are available on sub-commands. Status does not
need the persistent nature.

Closes #8149

body: @marckhouzam I created #8183 to move it to a flag. I also noticed that the revision flag is showing up on the tip of master right now. Is this PR or issue still needed?

> @marckhouzam I created #8183 to move it to a flag. I also noticed that the revision flag is showing up on the tip of master right now. Is this PR or issue still needed?

Since  #7917 was reverted, the bug has disappeared.  However, I think we might as well make the change to the revision flag anyway, as you have done in #8183, to remove the risk of this problem re-appearing.

> The revert was done in #8153

I'm closing this issue as the problem is gone, irrespective of what we decide to do about #8183.
